intro: Zaluzianskya chasmanthiflora, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring, resembling small bells. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Zaluzianskya chasmanthiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
